org.fest.swing.fixture
Class WindowFixture<T extends Window>

java.lang.Object
  org.fest.swing.fixture.ComponentFixture<T>
      org.fest.swing.fixture.JMenuItemContainerFixture<T>
          org.fest.swing.fixture.ContainerFixture<T>
              org.fest.swing.fixture.WindowFixture<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of window handled by this fixture.
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogFixture, FrameFixture
public abstract class WindowFixture<T extends Window>
extends ContainerFixture<T>

Understands simulation of user events on a Window and verification of the state of such Window.

Author:
Alex Ruiz

Constructor Detail

WindowFixture

public WindowFixture(Class<? extends T> type)
Creates a new WindowFixture. This constructor creates a new RobotFixture containing the current AWT hierarchy.

Parameters:
type - the type of Window to find using the created RobotFixture.
Throws:
ComponentLookupException - if a Window having a matching name could not be found.
See Also:
RobotFixture.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy()

Parameters:
robot - performs simulation of user events on a Window.
type - the type of Window to find using the given RobotFixture.
Throws:
ComponentLookupException - if a dialog having a matching name could not be found.

Method Detail

cleanUp

public final void cleanUp()
Cleans up any used resources (keyboard, mouse, open windows and ScreenLock) used by this robot.
